snippet: United Nations cease-fire monitors were due to arrive in Syria on Sunday even as activists described violence erupting in Homs and an area near the Turkish border.
abstract: Shellfire continues to rake central Homs and other flash points in Syria as United Nations prepares for monitoring mission; reports from around country suggest that cease-fire is holding in places, with notable exceptions.

byline.contributor: Hala Droubi contributed reporting from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: United Nations cease-fire monitors were due to arrive in Syria on Sunday even as activists described violence erupting in Homs and an area near the Turkish border.

headline.seo: Lapses in Syria Cease-Fire as U.N. Monitors Prepare for Entry
headline.main: Lapses in Cease-Fire Reported as U.N. Monitors Prepare to Begin Mission in Syria
headline.print_headline: Lapses in Cease-Fire Reported as U.N. Monitors Prepare to Begin Mission in Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
